review: The best thing about the slow service was it delayed the time before you had to eat the bad food.  From rubbery chicken to bland pasta to cheesecake that was nearly frozen solid, this experience was a complete disaster.    On a small positive note, the staff was all friendly.
Food blows!  Service sucks! Management is passive, to say the least!!!

STAY AWAY!!!  This is the worst T.G.I.'s in the area, the staff is rude, lazy and very slow.  The management is non-existent.   The kitchen is untrained and slower then pond water.  Not that it matters, because once your food is ready the wait staff is going to take so long to bring it out to you that you won't want to eat it anyway.

I got very violent food poisoning here. And spent the next 36 hours puking my brains out. I thought I was going to die!!  Besides that the food was below average quality and the wait staff was very ghetto. Not a nice location. Despite my bad experience, I have gone to other locations since then in other cities and had better experiences. Not here though, first and last time at Woodbridge TGI Fridays!!

I agree with pretty much every comment that has been left on here. Been here every once in a while over the years. -Overall, the food is bland and overly pricey. -For a place known for its drinks, I usually find myself disappointed with their drinks time and time again. -Service is slow, but its never been rude. -Even though there were plenty of free tables, we had to wait cause they told us they were understaffed and didn't want to over seat any of the servers. Overall, average at best.

I really should have read the reviews before deciding to stop here for lunch. The food was cold. I guess the didn't microwave it enough. The waitress was pleasant but slow to bring my food and the check. Going back to this place reallu adds no value to my life.
There are many better option in the area. The food is not very good with service to match.

Not sure of why everyone has had a terrible experience here. Hubs and I went last night for dinner. We asked for a booth and was sat in the bar area, whcih I'm fine with, there was barely anyone else there. Our server was very funny. We like to order everything at once, just because we're weird like that. I ask if that's okay and our server says that he'll be our Huckleberry. Not sure what that meant, but okay. I got Mozarella sticks, and the flat iron steak, medium rare with broccoli and mashed potatoes. It was all very good and very filling, I couldn't even finish it. Service was a little slow, but I think that was because there was only one server for all of the bar area. Oh well.
Awful. Disgusting.  Walked to our table,  sat down and my arms stuck to the table.  Pretty sure I saw someone's dinner on the floor

I was confused by the rest of reviews. When my husband and I got here it was packed but they found an open booth for us immediately. Our waiter Joshua made sure everything was to our liking. It's not a five star meal but def five star service.

If I could, I'd probably give this a 1/2 a star it was so terrible.  My husband and I stopped in after dropping off his tux at Men's Warehouse.  His receipt from Men's warehouse showed the time of 4:26 PM, putting us at TGIF across the street at nearly exactly 4:30.  We first arrived and they had to have someone clean a table for us.  Mind you there were about 5 other visibly open clean tables.  So while we are waiting 10 minutes for our table to be cleaned another family comes in after us asking for a party of 8-10 people.  They were told they would need to wait 30 minutes to be seated, when there were no others in line and open tables that could be quickly pushed together to seat them, probably in less time then it took them to clean our table.... After wishing them good luck, we headed to our booth, where we proceeded to put in our drink and apps order.  We were told immediately that the bar was backed up so that my milkshake and his beer may take awhile..... After waiting about 25 minutes, my husband's beer came out -- Still no milkshake. We placed our dinner order and about the 45 minute mark, our appetizer finally came out, which was actually good.  Still no milkshake.  So finally the manager comes to inform me that they are out of milk and they are sending someone to WalMart to buy some more -- When it arrived, my milkshake would be on the house.....  So we wait some more. Finally our meals come out about the hour and 20 minute mark.  My husbands Jack Daniel Double shrimp was not good. He didn't even eat half of it.  His caesar salad which came out with his meal was disgusting.  My black bean burger was not great, but ok, after I waited another five minutes for mayo.  My salad had wilted lettuce and came with the wrong dressing.... The bathrooms were not very clean and the whole experience was pretty terrible.  I did finally get my milkshake and it was pretty good..... Our total meal came to about $50 and probably the biggest waste of $50 in a long time.  Our server was nice, but slow and overwhelmed.  The entire facility does not appear to be well managed and though the staff appears to be working really hard, it's clear that they are short on staff.   Each time we have gone to TGIF it's been subpar. I was really thinking this time it might be better since they've changed up their menu a bit, but sadly I was mistaken. There are a ton of other restaurants in the area.  Don't waste your time at this one.

Food was alright.  But the service wasn't.  They are always really busy and maybe understaffed, I'm not sure. It is just a trashy place, and the people working there seemed like it too.  When i was waiting for a table I went to the bar to get a drink and it took forever for the bartender to ask what I'd like.  Food took forever to get.  The waitess got our order wrong. And then she didn't come back to refill our drinks. Won't be going back.

I love it here.. good food and great service on the regular but Ok here goes the part I did not like at all.  So apparently now on Friday (and I think Sat) nights they are "trying," to do a lounge type of thing.  I consider this a major fail and this is why.   1.) music that is played is pretty much one genre (hood twerk, rap, and very urban with no variety- which makes it obviously a place that will only attract one type of crowd - you get where I am going).  Please don't get me wrong too I love to live it up in the club and twerk a lil bit but not over my meal (nor do I want to see a big chick attempting to break into a freakish dance next to me in a tight ill fitting dress looking like a half opened can of cookie dough).   2.) The constant patrol of the security guy freaked me out to another level.  Sir this is not Detroit or a prison so please stop walking around with your flashlight. 3.) The DJ constantly coming over the mic to holler and yell and people coming in and out.  Also the shoutout thing is not cute.   4.) I had literally had to help the girl clean off the table because she was so overwhelmed by the noise, craziness, and constant demand for her.  I felt bad for her and I hope she made it through the night.   So in conclusion if you are in Hoodbridge and you are not feeling like hitting up a rachet club in DC this may be for you.   The two stars would have been three however with the lounge type thing they have going on and my usual tendency to eat in the evenings kind of ruined it for me.  Other saving graces are the fast service, attentive and night wait staff.

They(my friends)  said they wanted to go to Fridays; I should've said no no no! Gosh how this place isn't shut down is beyond me. This place has a weird stench I remember each time I've been. This is my last time going to this location. Server was nice but SUPER SLOW!!! Ordered a Bacardi bc they don't have any other silver rum. My drink took over 15 minutes to arrive. Apps were average and not very warm. The chicken tasted frost burned(yuck). The friends wanted dessert but I was not waiting another 30 minutes to get that. No sir not me! This place has no redeeming qualities.  FINAL RECOMMENDATION(Tabatha Coffey voice)  DON'T EVER WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE!!!

Pros: Service was better than previous experiences, sat down immediately  Cons: Food quality continues to be down, drinks are watered down/filled with mixers           After MANY bad experiences with T.G.I.Fridays we decided to try it out once again. We have had a bad experience in the past with this exact T.G.I.Fridays with some of the management being rude, and the quality of food being horrible. PAST Experience: Found a large piece of plastic in my mashed potatoes (they're shipped in a plastic bag. The manager at the time was less than apologetic. The overall manager was nice and offered to help make the experience better.) RECENT:  We went here after many bad experiences hoping that our faith would be restored but sadly we were let down. We were sat fairly quickly for being a later Friday night (8:00pm). Although this could be seen as a bad thing as most restaurants in Woodbridge would have had a wait. I will say the service was pretty good this time around. Takiia our server was fairly nice and was good to meet our every need. She didn't exactly go above and beyond by any means, but better than previous experiences. Drinks (alcohol drinks) were watered down. Sadly our main complaint is towards the food again! My frustration is with the California club. I have been ordering it for many lunches on the ciabatta bread, to find out tonight that it has changed to the baguette but wasn't changed on the menu. (It has been changed on the online menu). Most servers didn't even know it had changed. My other concern is my wife's food. She ordered a New York Cheddar and Bacon Burger and bit down on a small, hard, white object in her burger meat, such as a piece of bone or similar item. It was probably the size of a pea - half dime. We didn't bring either issue up to our server as we hate to be those people who complain, although I do want to pass this information to hopefully warn others about the food here. We're sad to say that we won't be going back to T.G.I.Fridays in the future with the past issues with food and service. We used to have great experiences here and looked forward to the food, but until the quality of both rises, we will never return.

Unfortunately I couldn't give them no stars as that's not an option. ..I agree with all the other ratings.  I thought i'd give it the benefit of a doubt but I was wrong I ordered a simple turkey burger with fries I would've done better going to hardys the patty was dry felt like I bit into cardboard the fries they we re hot and hard like my entire meal was out od the microwave yet it took 30 minutes ..NEVER again will I go back
They did good tonight. My friend gave them a bad rating. I would come again.

I was not terribly impressed with this place. I had the jack daniels chicken sandwich which was pretty good. My waitress was amazing. I was kind of disappointed that she wasn't the one bringing us our food and drinks considering it wasn't that busy, but she more than made up for it in service. I only give this place 2 stars however because we had the unfortunate luck of sitting next to the door and the greeter's stand. Since it was not busy, a lot of the waiters came to stand there and complain about their customers and sit around. They didn't really pay much attention to the fact they had customers sitting right next to them. It was also unsettling to watch them play around with each other and at one point in each others hair, and then go on to someone's table and handle food. Long story short, the food was ok, my waitress was a sweetheart, but the atmosphere was a little uncomfortable.

Went here for early Sunday lunch.  We were one of the first tables in, and we sat at the first table in the bar. Food was alright, didnt have to wait too long.   Server was also the bartender.  I suppose because it was still early and no bar crowd yet.  He was so indifferent and personality-free.

I usually always go to the TGIFridays in Tysons Mall for happy hour and it is almost always packed. I always thought that it was packed solely because of its location, but now I know that the quality of food and drinks the TGIFridays may actually play a role in its popularity as a happy hour destination. I decided to go happy hour at TGIFridays in Woodbridge when I was in the area and I was greatly disappointed. I didn't think that there could be a big discrepancy between different TGIFridays, but yes there is as proven by the this TGIF.  My major complaint about this TGIF is the quality of food and drinks, and yes there is a big difference. We ordered the long island ice tea, mojito and a blue moon and all tasted horrible (YES, even a blue moon draft tasted bad...). The long island ice tea was basically clear, watered down, and barely had any coke. The mojito was watered down and tasted like the sugar syrup. The blue moon tasted like coke that tasted like soda water..basically it was carbonated beer. I have never had such a bad experience with drinks at TGIF.....I highly do not recommend going to this TGIF at all, even if the drinks are discounted....

Huh. I had to check the address twice to make sure I was reviewing the right place. My experience was nothing like many of these others. Having lunch with a friend, we walked in, were greeted quickly and got a booth immediately. Server took orders right away and was very friendly.  I had a margarita on the $3 menu and we split some appetizers. The fried green beans, spinich dip and mozerella were my favorites. Food arrived hot, well cooked and quick.  No complaints and full intentions of going again soon!

We were out shopping and decided to try TGI Fridays for lunch. Big Mistake! The table was dirty,we ordered a drink which was Horrible! Ordered potato skins ,they came with hardly any cheese on them,they were dry and tasted old and came out of the microwave. Then we told the waiter about it and he sent them back to the cook,who he said was the manager.The manger came out ,very rude and said this is how much cheese we put on them. I said who cares and it was very dry. You are to please the customer and he did not care one bit about the quality of food he was serving ! The burger my friend ordered was greasy and nasty. After we ate we both got sick. Will never go there again!   Gave it one star but they don't deserve THAT! SUCKS

The restaurant is never consistent. Nothing will ever be the same twice. Ordered hot chocolate on a Friday and it came out made and ready to drink came back on a Monday and was told they did not sell hot chocolate but once I reassured the waiter that they did serve hot chocolate it was brought to me with a cup of hot water a hot chocolate packet that you buy at the store and i had to request whip cream twice . My grilled chicken came out pink and the waiter was not attentive. The layout has changed but the quality and service have not.
I have never been impressed with the food here. But it is a great place to drink and hang out with friends at the bar. The bar area at this particular Friday's can get a little crowded at times.

I went this past Saturday. The place looks great, major facelift. Our server was great, recommended great food off the menu. I have not eaten a steak in a few years. I have had a bad experience. Any how Ryan (our Server) recommended I try the Jack Daniel steak. IT was very very good. I was very impress. I have to say, I have not been to this Friday's in almost a year, because it smelled like mildew, but now after their makeover, It look great, drinks are good. I will go back again.
They have changed it quite a bit. They now have better deals like Jack Daniels Tuesday. They have good quality food and I like when their chicken isn't burnt but I wish their sides weren't so yucky.

My boyfriend and I come here quite often as it is a place that is open late as we both work rather late shifts. Normally it is a fantastic place with a nice atmosphere and great staff. However today after working a late shift and I go in and what I saw was beyond appalling it was downright revolting.  The people at the bar were extremely loud And very rude and exceptionally vulgar. As my hour here progressed; I felt more and more uncomfortable and at points felt more than a little threatened by the increasing homophobic statements coming from a group at the bar. They made several rude, callus and derogatory statements towards gay people in general and used of course, vulgar language.  Normally my boyfriend and I love to go go here, and I am thankful I came alone tonight because I would have been terrified to bring my boyfriend here and I am thankful I didn't. After what I saw here tonight I would be hard pressed to come here ever again. Seeing as though management tolerates extremely homophobic and vulgar bar patrons, since I saw the manager off in a corner laughing and never once asking the group at the bar to perhaps not shout at the top of their lungs and maybe they don't need to use such staggeringly inappropriate language.  My Final thoughts are, Great food, great wait staff, horrible atmosphere that made me uncomfortable and downright afraid for my safety and would make me think twice about ever bringing my boyfriend or any of our friends here after work.

Unfortunately, I didn't have a very good experience here. Came a bit after lunch time and the restaurant was half empty, but still had to wait 15 mins to be seated. Ordered a orange juice with no ice for my daughter and they brought out a glass half full. I questioned why it was like that and they said because I asked for no ice. Seriously??? I thought it was a joke at first... I was sadly mistaken. I thought the food was pretty good and service was ok. I had a $5 off coupon, but the waitress said I couldn't use it because I had ordered their appetizer and entree deal, which i guess they consider it to be a coupon discount, and they can't accept 2 coupons. I told them to take the $5 off a different entree, but they said they could only accept 1 coupon per table. After having to explain that I'm only using 1 coupon and the items were ordered off menu, the manager was finally able to make it work. $5 isn't a big deal and we sill tipped 20%, but that was a whole lot more effort than was necessary. Suffice to say, I was already annoyed after the orange juice incident... but knew it wasn't the waitress's fault.
Marian is the best bartender on Worth Ave. She needs a better uniform. The new red shirt, black vest thing isn't working for her. The food is good, and cheap around midnight. That's it.

I went in on a Saturday afternoon and the service was horrible.  The place was not that full, but there was a wait.  When my kids and I were seated, the server/waiter never came.  It's not like we were hidden.  We sat for 20 minutes (Yes, I did time it) and no one came.  I saw the manager back by the register talking with a waitress and eating, then he disappeared back into the kitchen.  We got up and slowly put on our coats.  Then we walked out.  I called the place from outside and it took 9 minutes for the hostess to get the manager on the phone.  When I explained to him that we were waiting for 20 minutes he didn't even believe we were in there.  He said "I didn't even see you guys, where were you sitting?"  I told him exactly where we had been sitting and told him that our menus were still on the table.  The only thing he said was that he would have a talk with his staff.

This place needs to get it together. My husband & I once came here & our waitress' shirt was so low cut & her girls were literally spilling out of her shirt to the point it made us both uncomfortable . The food was okay but service slow. The entire Time I had the sun in my face to the point i was blinded & asked to but the shades down. Attitude was given but eventually she complied.  Another time I brought my family that was visiting from florida. After a 13 hour drive they were starving. Big mistake. It was around 8pm on a Wednesday. Place was pretty empty. & we were a party of 7. Walked in & was told we'd have to wait despite no one actually being there. 20 minutes later & 5 couples that walked In a got seated we were finally sat. That should've been a sign. The waitress was rude when asking if something was good or not. Forgot a drink. Food took 45 minutes, & was told the wait was due to cook walking out. Appetizers weren't delivered til reminding them. Steak was cold. Sauces were forgotten. & after food was delivered waitress went MIA. Probably because she knew service SUCKED and thought they're not gonna tip so why bother? Drinks were never filled. It was sad. A manager came by to ask about our experience & boy did we tell them. They offered free desert. All of us were pretty much done, but my father wanted some Oreo ice cream sandwich thing. 20 minutes later we were so upset we paid and left. On our way out some girl delivers a sad excuse for a dessert that literally looked like it came out of a wrapper. WHY'D IT TAKE SO LONG?! Don't go there. It's literally a giant disappointment. I ended up getting coupons in the from this experience.... But will never go to THAT location.

The worst Friday's I've ever being at. My mother and I came in to have an early dinner. The place was pretty empty, the bar area was a mess. We were asked to wait for about 15 minutes until finally we got seated. Service was pretty slow. But I would care less until my mother got a spoiled mozzarella salad. My burger was overcooked and I literally had  a better ones in McDonald's.  Nothing but the upset stomach you would get from eating there.

DO NOT COME HERE!!!  YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!! Seriously, this place is awful. We should've known the moment we walked in and the hostess told us there were no booths available when the restaurant was empty. We were starving so we didn't put up a fight and sat in high chairs by the bar area. Normally, this wouldn't bother me but it only went downhill from there.  Here are some reasons you shouldn't come here: 1) No soap in the bathroom. Fine, you ran out. Refill it. It shouldn't take me two times of asking and another 15 min wait.  2) Appetizer: chicken flat bread. Matzah has more flavor.  3) Soda was supposed to be coke zero and tasted like root beer. 4) Waiting on burgers. 5) Still waiting... 6) Starving and waiting... 7) After 30-40 minutes my friend and I got our burgers but my girlfriend didn't. The fries had no seasoning, and our double stack all American burgers were tiny and overcooked. The term "well done" was taken to a whole new level. I don't think I've ever had a restaurant burger that had crunch to it from being so overcooked. Also, I asked for no bacon on mine and I got bacon.  8) The server came out and brought my girlfriend's burger which was the spicy craft beer-cheese burger. It's supposed to come with fried jalapenos and regular jalapenos. What came out did not remotely resemble that. It had two pieces of what was supposed to be fried jalapenos, which really looked like fried batter and a smidget of jalapeno. There were no regular jalapenos in it.  Despite all of this, our server was a nice guy. But, service in general lagged to say the least and kitchen staff were completely disoriented. They had to have been if they could throw out the crap food they provided.  Moral of the story: We should've gone to Five Guys

My husband and I went there last night. We walked in and were told it was going to be a 20 minute wait and there were maybe 6 or 7 tables with people sitting down the rest were empty. Either they need a new manager to get more staff or they need new hostess' to do there job. It made the whole place look bad. We asked to sit at the bar and were told that there was too much of a wait. Really the 3 families out side all were waiting for the 7 or so booths at the bar, I don't think so. Lies! The only saving grace that gives it a two star and not a one star is that my husband liked his food and the mozzarella sticks were awesome. My food was ok, but nothing to brag about. I'm also going to say that a pet peeve of mine is a dirty bathroom. Makes you wonder if the kitchen is clean and although this one was clean... Kind of, the paper towel dispenser was automatic as many of them are now days. Not to problem normally, but this one would only give you maybe three inches of paper then you had to rip it off to get more. I'm not sure who has tiny enough hands to actually try there hands with that little paper towel. It made me think that the managers in charge or whoever is in charge are just cheap people that don't care about the customers. This is one person that won't be returning!!

We ate here today, and what an experience.  First the table was dirty, and had some sort of sticky substance on top.  The appetizer was fried mozzarella sticks.  They were run of the mill ok.  The waitress brought out the plates for the appetizer, and they were greasy.  I ordered the iron skillet, with the baby back ribs.  It was cooked the right way, came out in time, and was ok.  This plate came with two sides.  My second side never made it to the table, and I had to take it to go. My wife ordered the pecan chicken salad, and she said it had a chemical taste to it.  The waitress took the salad off the bill with no problems.  Not a very good spot for dinner.

This place was absolutely horrible! I decided to pop in and grab a quick bite to go before going to see a movie at the theater nearby, and I could not wait to get out of there. I contemplated sitting inside and eating my food, but quickly vetoed that idea when I got to the front door.  There were people right by the door loitering like it was a club, smoking and making it incredibly uncomfortable to to inside. Right by the hostess stand there was a DJ, and the music was so loud I couldn't even hear myself think. I had to waive over a hostess and we had to walk away from the door and DJ just so she could hear my order.  The place was dead, understandable given how loud everything was, and how it seemed more like a club than a restaurant, which was inappropriate for a 'family' restaurant so close to a mall on a Friday evening. It was barely 9pm when I got there and it was so loud and obnoxious that I didn't even want to sit in the restaurant to wait for my to-go appetizer.  It took forever just to get that, and I'm so glad that I didn't order anything more complicated than the chicken strips.  The food itself was well prepared, but there was no consideration for patrons who might have wanted dinner without the loud music. There wasn't a special event going on, and it was like trying to sit inside a speaker.  Overall it was a horrible experience, and completely unexpected for the Friday's closest to Potomac Mills. I could not expect trying to actually sit in and have a meal there, given how inattentive the staff was and how slow the food service was. Do Not Go. If I could give this place negative stars I would.

Should've read the reviews on this one. Went to a different TGIF on Thursday to watch the game and had a great experience. This one, we sat down ignored for about 20 min then 1 person finally came by, took drink orders, then 2 more people came by to take drink orders.  This was the only time my water glass was full and it took more than 15 min to get our drinks (Wife and her mother had mixed drinks) me the driver water.  We always order our son's food 1st as he is 15 mo. they decided to hold his order until they brought ours, even though we ordered it with the drinks??? We order dinner took 40+ min to arrive so 15mo had been waiting for over and hour, imagine his sunny disposition, but we were committed at this point. My Wife and MIL dinners came out ok they had chicken skewers and pasta something, but it mine where it gets fun. I ordered the Ribeye off the grill med rare - which should be normal basic I can pass my cooking class skill. After waiting the 40+ min the steak was raw. It had been basically seared both sides and sent the fat was still solid and it was cook to the touch. By the time the server came around to follow up enough time had elapsed that Wife and MIL were near done. The Manager was apologetic and insisted I take one to go with me no charge ok nice. The steak that came out was so done it like leather couldn't eat that one either, so I ended up after 2+ hours in this TGIF getting a PBJ at home.

Service was great in our server was very attentive and nice, which was the only bright spot. We ordered endless apps and got boneless chicken wings and received some very hard old tasting chicken wings. I ordered a medium steak which came way over cooked. I had to send it back it was replaced by the driest steak ever. I'm not sure how they got the steaks so desert dry it was as if they cooked it in a dehydrator
Sad crowd, sad food, sad staff. Just all around sad. Friday Night, 8 PM
Great food / service staff great but Mr.Mike and young greeter make this TGIF EVEN BETTER!!!!! When they go so will I.  JUST GREAT THANKS        TGIF

I'd stopped going to Fridays once I found a happy hour spot that provided what I wanted.  On occasion  I'd see construction projects going on at this location.  I assumed that everything was being upgraded.  I WAS WRONG!  Don't get it twisted, I understand you are not going to get a 5-star experience at a chain restaurant and that's okay.  The problem arises when the experience you do receive is below even the basic margin.  I ordered the rib trio with fries.  The sauces on the rib were inspiring and that was it.  These ribs had been boiled and doused in different sauces.  My French fries, which I ordered after I'd ordered the ribs, came out lower than room temperature, damm near cold!  I requested a fresh order and they were better:  IF I WERE A SALT FREAK!  Those fries were so thick with salt I could actually see it. Now, I send THOSE back and on the third time, they get it right.  The 2 stars are for the server ( she was on her job and she took the fries off the tab) and the beer.  Those were the only bright spots in a dismal experience.  Fridays may want to divert some of that facade money to upgrading the menu and the cooks.

Worst TGI I've ever been too in my life, SUPER slow service until we got extremely pissed and left. And man let me tell you about the manager... I don't knoe how to start but here (DUMB BLOND MANAGER) she seems like the type of manager that wants to be friends with her servers, I felt like the servers were managing her like she's so dumb all she said to us I'm sorry imma have a little talk with them and she left, and service was still shit

So awful. Potato skins looked and tasted like microwaved, mass produced crap from a frozen box they sell at grocery stores. Naturally they're more expensive at the restaurant, but they're poor quality. I asked for the Jack Daniels chicken strips without the sauce. So they bring me an entirely different item of something equivalent to chicken nuggets from McD's, hoping I won't know the difference. Wrong. The bar area was like a down-low nightclub, complete with loud trashy chicks hanging all over some guy and competing for his attention. So not the family establishment it once was. I won't ever return. And this was on a Saturday afternoon at 1pm.

The Jack Daniels menu is the only reason I keep coming back here. Most of the time I order to go, but either way most of the staff I've interacted with are incompetent. I walked in to 3 ladies standing at the hostess station and instead of saying a simple, "hello" they stared at me with wide eyes and a dumbfounded look. This most recent time the girl brought out an order for someone else, hands it to me and I can tell immediately its not mine. She proceeds to say its mine with uncertainty and obviously didn't care one bit whose order it was. The most irritating part about this location? You call to place an order, someone picks up and immediately hangs up. Every single time. They must hire morons only.

Horrible customer service the hostess said there was no wait for the bar just find a seat than an older guy walks up when I take sit down and says there's a wait you have to get up and wait I said the hostess said we could sit and he was just like get up other people have been waiting longer you can go on the list and he was a "manger" when I asked for one smfh worst experience  -10 out of 10 I proceeded to say fuck you a leave due to the horrible experience

horrid service !! had enough time to download the yelp app to write this review ! waited 20 mins to get seated in an empty restaurant!  waited another 20 mins for cold appetizers ! and another 30 for cold lunch !! wasted 2.5 hours on a Saturday never again ever stay away

Probably worst experience at a restaurant ever. Took about ten minutes to even be greeted. I ordered a bar drink, the other three got sodas. They got sodas and it took another ten minutes to get my bar drink. Ordered steak medium rare came medium well. Asked for A-1 then half way through my steak she told me "I'm sorry they are 'looking' for your A-1 now". But HA only took a second for her to come back for our check.

Not a great experience, not even good. We were seated fast, because it wasn't busy. But it took almost 10 mins till our waitress approached us and took our drink order. The signature slushies weren't even a slushie. It was more like a blue syrup with crushed ice on the top. Appetizers took 25 mins to come out. When it did the correct sauces were not even with it. We had to continuously as another waitress for things. My drink refill took about 30 mins and the waitress didn't even take away my emptied cup. The entrées came out and my chicken look under cooked. I don't see myself returning to this location or recommending it to anyone.

This was the absolute worst service my family has ever received from a restaurant.  We waited an hour for our food to come out and it came out wrong!!! We had to send back 3 of the orders and they came out wrong again!!!!!  This was service we received on a $150.00 bill.  The manager Becky was very sub standard and was not responsive and lacked control, influence and ability to make a difference with the horrible service we experienced.

Service sucks and I waited way too long for my food I sat iat my seat andbwaited like 30 minutes for a wait or and their attitudes weren't the most pleasant. In other words go to IHOP if you want good service
The people that worked there were more interested in helping then Poole they knew already that me and my friend I mean it wasn't a bad place but it could have been Better
The worst TGIF spot I ever been to. I had the ribs and they were dry and not season well. My kids did not enjoy their food also. They need to shut this restaurant down. Not a good spot.

For the 2nd time in the same year, my husband and I tried to eat at TGI Fridays in Woodbridge.  The first time we sat in the bar area and watched the waiters and waitresses run by our booth a few times.  One of the waitresses finally stopped and said she would be right with us. We waited about another 10 minutes and still nothing, no drink order was taken, nothing!!  Then we just gave them another try this past Saturday evening.  It was about 8:30pm and we went in and should have known right away it wasn't going to be good.  They weren't very busy, but when we looked around almost all of the empty tables in there were dirty.  We were going to try and sit in the bar, but the only booth that was empty was dirty, so we just said we would like to sit in the dining room.  My husband sat down and I went to use the ladies room, when I got back nobody had come to the table yet.  He said a waiter came and helped the people sitting at the table next to ours, but that was it.  We sat there for about 5 minutes and still nobody had come by for a drink order.  For the next 5-10 minutes we were discussing where to go eat now and still nobody came to the table so once again we just up and left.  This will be our last time giving them a try.  If you want good service this is not the place to go.  I couldn't even rate the water in this place because we couldn't even get that!!!!  If I could give them 0 stars I would.

I give them one star because I can't give them zero stars! Worst place ever. It took us 2 hours to have dinner and we didn't even get desert. They really need to get there S together cause this place is horrible. Last time is visited them was about 2 years ago and there is a reason for that. I will not return for at least another 2 years in hopes they get there S together. Mean while, we watched our waitress mop floors in the kitchen while our food took forever to get our table. More waitresses and waiters then what they need to have because they were not busy at all. Obviously not enough cooks because the food took so long to come out that I wish we had just gone somewhere else. End of story service is terrible and the manager just doesn't give a S about the customers! Maybe one day we can have TGI Fridays everyone raves about, but until thin... Avoid this place at all possibilities!!

Came in at 4:15pm with my ma and little sister and was surprised at the service (especially after I read the other reviews on this location AFTER already sat at my booth). I've been to other TGI Friday's and this is the best out of all. My server was great. He seems very genuine and courteous (Why can't I remember his name??? He needs major kudos. Anyway, he was a slim dude with dark hair.) I asked for a replacement (side salad instead of fries) for my burger and my ma, as always, asked for substitutions in her burgers and we got what we ordered. Finished of  our meal with Tennessee Whiskey Cake and it was delicious. We weren't rushed to pay and get out either, which is the norm at the FairLake TGI that I used to go to often.

Never fails at this location that my well done steak is bloody or the service is lacking. This is written while I'm sitting watching everyone at my table eating for the past 15 minutes. Imagine how happy I am.
The bar area smells like thrown up beer and bleach. Please do us all a favor and figure out how to get rid of the smell. While waiting in a take out order it made me want to vomit.
The worst customer service,  including the management.  The quality of the food is just as bad.

I too, like a few other yelpers, have and currently work in a restaurant.  I was looking for a place to have my lunch before going to work and TGIF popped up as one of the first in the search. Because this place has a 2-star rating, I wanted to  give it a try to see what the fuss is about.  I am giving a rating of 4 stars just because the host was super nice.  Although I waited at the door about 3 minutes for the host to sit someone else that was in line before me :-) I was attended to with a smile and a warning. I was told that while I would be seated immediately, my food might take longer than usual to arrive.  I asked what the delay would be and I was told about 20-25 which to me, seemed very reasonable on a day where the parking lot seemed full and the restaurant and bar looked quite full. Because I was a given a warning about my food delay and because maybe the 20 minutes delay might turn into 40 I thanked the host and walked away.  I would definitely comeback when I have a good hour to myself, unfortunately today, I'm on my way to work so I guess I'll eat for free at work instead.

Food was good but service at the bar was terrible.    They try and rush you out at a rediculous pace.  Offer you dessert while you're still eating.  Give you your check while you have a full beer.   Not worth coming back.

I see why this place has two stars. The bartender took a while to greet us. So the bartender we had smelled funny, like he went to the gym and than straight to work. My nose is super sensitive lol. Don't judge me. Anywho, we ordered some wings, pot stickers, and the crown Apple coolers.  The drinks were good, and the food was hot. The reason why I'm giving them three stars is because the bartender forgot about us. Luckily, Ms. Lexis was there to rescue us. It was nice to talk to her. She gave the experience that a person going to a happy hour should have.  It didn't hurt she was from my hometown. So in a nutshell, he sucked and she was awesome. We would still come back, but hopefully Lexis is there.

I never said that I wish I could give 0 stars for a business and I never quite understood people who said that. Then I had to experience this horse shit. If it wasn't for the fact that my pregnant fiance was craving a Cajun pasta and the only effing place that I was able to get that at 2222 hours... I would've had taken my money else where and gladly eat somewhere else and save an hour and half of my damn life. It first started off by them hanging up on me twice while being on hold for about 5 minutes each. Then I was on hold for 12 minutes on my 3rd call when I said this was bull**** and drove down to place an order. Then we waited another 20 minutes before we were even able to place an order, another 10 minutes to grab a beer while I wait, then another 1 hour and 20 minutes for the food to come out. What a horrendous experience it has been
do not ever go. please. for all that is wholly. Kitchen is disgust. Service is worst.

This was the second bad experience I had with this location TGIF.                                                             Tonight I was on hold for 10 before I got hung up on. I called back to again be put on hold for 25 mins before someone took my order. It took the person I was speaking with 20 mins to take my order. When I asked for my total, I was asked to hold on. I was on hold waiting for my total for an additional 37 mins. Yes I held on because my husband was on his way to pick up the order, ( now on a conference call)I held on until he got there. Still on the phone with him and TGIF, he asked for the manager to complain about the service and to tell them I was STILL on the phone waiting. So now the order taker cones back to the phone with a total. I've been on the phone between holding on and being hung up on now for 90 mins. And all I got was I am sorry and 10% off my meal. Once my husband gets home with the order it was NOT correct. Our steak was not well done at all. We didn't want to make that trip back there, to go thru the extra.   The crew that was there this evening definitely need a mandatory customer service  hospitality training class lecture badly.     This restaurant will not receive anymore service from me. And I will spread the word to others about our experiences. Lucky I even gave you one star. Customer service ,food, and order was ALL wrong.
Poor service and lousy food. My steak was completely burnt and may have been prepared poorly.

I've always been happy with this spot and have Been living in this area for almost 15 years. But then again I don't go for the bar scene. Decent food and decent service every time I've gone and I'm usually pretty picky.
Don't bother going. They have an empty restaurant but won't take any customers because they don't have servers or enough people in the kitchen.

My wife and I visit here to get bite to eat on the way, after a very long day at event. We our order meals which included salads. The waiter ask did we want salads before meals come or before. We ask for the salads first. Well the salads never came. We order our meals again 1 cheeseburger cook medium well with lettuce, tomato, onion and mayo on the side. And absolutely no pickles allergies. Got the cheeseburger and the burger was still cold and what made matters worse no onion. Even though the burger was cold it had pickles under cheese. Luckily my wife took a bite of the before I did. Cause if I had ate the burger I would have had cardiac stroke and it would been worse. My wife order Bruschshrimp  with no-Parmesan well it came with it. So my wife was upset. because it was like the waiter wasn't listening or just didnt care. Cause he repeated everything we order and nothing came back correct. I  just just pay the bill to which I did and left.  Nevertheless I don't what the problem there but this the very worst experience at a TGIF, Cause I would been alittle more understanding if the manager was avaliable but he had step away for a minute be back. The other problem was I didnt understand why everything was wrong because the resturant was pretty much empty less then 10 tables were occupy with customers. And our order took 30 minutes or so minutes. When I ask for the check the salads were on the bill. I called to the waiter and told him the bill was wrong. He corrected and return with explanation that it was the kitchen mixup. Anyway. We have been coming Fridays for awhile usually at  the 22302 Alexandria about once or twice a month. But this our first time visit at this one and I don't think we'll ever comeback nor my family or co-workers. I think we start spending my money else most like APPLESBEES better services. When you get act together let me know maybe revisted, but no time soon,

I came here for lunch with a party of 3 on a Monday. The food came out quickly  and our orders were correct. We also had the Blue Rita Shaker with added Passion fruit. The drink was the highlight. The Mac and cheese is not so bueno. The crispy green beans were surprisingly good! There are lots of deals like the 474 and 345 and happy hour all day- you can get lost in the menu! Check with your server for he least expensive way to get what you want.

Bartender was really cool she was really interactive with myself & my brother - I wish more ppl would state their complaints on site instead of ranting on Yelp.. Initially she took a little while to get to us but it wasn't her fault they scheduled only 1 person she did the best she could & we appreciated her efforts under stress!
The night waitresses need to be replaced with people who actually have common sense....!!!!! They have horrible customer service!!!!!!! And
Not the best service, they don't care about good customer service. Crowd was loud and it was difficult for me to enjoy my meal. Good spot to just hang for a couple of drinks I guess.

Hello all!! So we had a party of 17. I was a little worried with such a big party...but DEVON our waiter was on top of it. We never had to ask twice. The food was awesome! Thanks Devon for making our experience awesome. Also it was one of my kids bday and he brought out icecream and sang. So great!

I don't go very often but I do love the food selection and they have always been known for their a stiff drinks.  I always have had a good experience except when these thirsty dudes got into a huge fight one time lol

Most definitely I've experienced better. Food isn't all the great for the price, and this restaurant should be turned into a giant bar instead. It wasn't very clean and the waitress was ok.  Came with my son, I ordered a steak and a hamburger for my son. Unfortunately I didn't see it on time but my son's burger wasn't fully cooked and later that evening at the house, he puked his guts out, it was funny to see them big chunks of meat shooting out of his nostrils but he was fine 20 mins after. Nevertheless I have not been here since that day. It just seems like a hang out place for drunks, specially when you see the security guards with handcuff. No thank you....restaurants shouldn't have security guards, let alone handcuffs.  But hey.......if you're a drunk? More powah to ya!!! This is definitely the place for you. Loud, obnoxious people, the occasional stabbing,.......yep, those days are gone for me but don't miss them either.  I'll stick with Chuy's or Ruby Tuesday. I'm guessing the drunks are too busy recovering from their hang overs and/or forgot to give this place their 5 star rating, because those that are not like that, are not having it with this place.

Was overall happy with the service they provided. Server was nice and the food didn't take long to come out. Their new drink specials were amazing!!  Can't wait to go back for happy hour!! The tiki drinks were so good. You have to try it with endless appetizers.

This is mine and my husband's favorite casual dining place. Yesterday happened to be our wedding anniversary and we weren't really in the mood for anything fancy so we decided to come here. Bad idea. We usually go to either Tysons or Springfield Friday's, but we recently moved to Woodbridge and this is the one closest to us. Bad service, bad food. Our server never came to our table unless we were able to get her attention. I asked for the Jack Daniel's burger and she didn't bother to ask how I wanted it cooked or what I wanted on it. I thought, fine... I'll just take the pickles off and I like my meat cooked pretty thoroughly, which is usually standard at most places. No biggie. I was about half way into my burger when I take a bite and pull out a piece of plastic wrap about 3 or 4 inches long. Yuck. It took away my appetite and we asked the waitress to take it back. She came back with a coupon card for a free desert on our next visit. Definitely won't be having it at this location. My husband had the Jack Daniel's sampler as his entree... This is our favorite appetizer and we get it almost every time. He said the ribs were burnt and tasted awful. The shrimp tasted like it was days old. We also got the BBQ Chicken Flatbread as a starter and it tasted like it had been sitting out for hours-on-end and popped into the microwave before it was served to us. Lastly, we ordered our all-time favorite dessert; Brownie Obsession. Such a disappointment. The brownie was cold, where as it is usually served super hot and moist and melty. I wish they had given our food to a different table like the girl who brought it out almost did before being told by those people that it wasn't theirs. All in all, bad experience at our favorite go-to restaurant.

So, decided to stop by here to grab a bite to eat thinking that it is a reputable restaurant chain that would not let us down.  BIG DISAPPOINTMENT! After sitting down and placing the order, I got a feeling that this place didn't care much about its existence.  Food was taking forever and waitress did not check on us for more than 30 minutes.  I got up to go to the restroom and saw her sitting and eating lunch at some table.  When I returned, she finally brought us our food and it definitely was NOT worth the wait.  Ordered Mahi Mahi sandwich and a wood grilled plate.  Sandwich had very little fish and the pita bread was obviously burnt.  Who brings out something like that from the kitchen and is ok to serve it?  A restaurant and chef that doesn't care!!!  Waitress didn't even check on us or ask us about our food for the whole time we were struggling to eat it.  Only reason why we did was because we were freakin' hungry.  We had to ask for the check and that was the only other time the waitress came to our table.  She only came to take order, serve food and get our money.  Pathetic!  Not even the basics done decently at this restaurant.  Service and meal both terrible.   I should have checked Yelp before going here because it had two stars and rated poorly.  I could have saved us the heartache.  The reviews on this restaurant is spot on.  Do not come here!

I used to love coming here.  The food was pretty good the atmosphere was enjoyable, but after my last trip on Sunday September 18th, I will be hard pressed to come back. We'll start with the server. She was a nice enough lady when we saw her those few times but when she did come to the table she smelled as though she had just chained smoked cigarettes. Moving on from there, I ordered the smoke stack burger, expecting what I had seen on the website, the burger patties and a split sausage link. What I got was the burgers patties with small spots of the sauces and a weird braised onion mixture with a couple of pieces of chopped meat that I could not identify.  (I like to assume it was sausage). And the fires were ice cold. After that the server didn't come back except to drop the check and swipe my credit card. Nobody asked how the food was, if it was cooked correctly or even to refill drinks. Poor poor service

Eh. The saving grace was the server and host who were super friendly and attentive. Our menus were falling apart and had stains on them. Burger ordered Med rare came med well and the fries where cold.

This has to be one of the worst Fridays in VA. I did a to go order and it took 30 mins mind you the restaurant was pretty empty at 1115pm. Then the BS food they served me was out of control. Somebody needs to fix this issuse quickly

So there is such a thing as bad customer service! The first couple of times we went to this specific TGIF it was an over all amazing experience. The food and service were beyond expectation. The last visit is what made me change my mind. I would never return to this location. The hostess was terrible! Young girl who couldn't get off her phone to even greet us  properly, she simply said "yes, can I help you!?"  And rolled her eyes... She then showed us to our table and didn't speak to us at all! Not even a word!  The waiter was just okay. He brought us out an item with ingredients that were missing... why not just say sorry the item isn't available!?  The two then continue to be loud and belligerent with two young men who they seem to know as they sat in the same area as us.  Instead of paying attention to guest the girl was busy exchanging social media contents, and arguing on her phone with possibly a boyfriend.  Not the right place or time for that sort of behavior!

Came in for a lunch break. Sat down at 1:22. Ordered a beer at 1:27. Received my beer at 1:57...The wings here aren't the best either, kind of "floppy." Our waiter was very friendly, but I think the problem is just lack of communication between the people working here. The quality of food is disappointing to put it nicely. Are mozzarella sticks supposed to be floppy and cold in the center?  Update: Went to restroom, toilet seats are coated in dried up pee.  I can guarantee it's been there for a few days.  Also no soap to wash my hands properly, I sure hope the employees have their own restrooms to use with soap in it.... it is now 2:16 I'm getting my check and getting the hell out of here. Definitely not coming back to this location.

Service was good even though it's a Friday night. We did the all you can eat apps; portions are small after the 1st plate which is great. Though, I don't recommend the bbq flatbread. It's taste like it was microwaved and left out til the server got the chance to bring it out. The server was good. He was busy, I'm guessing they're short staffed. He managed acouple of tables and asked use several times if everything was good or if we needed drinks. That aspect it was a good experience at this location. Again stay away from the flat bread I currently feel like I am going to hurl chunks

We ordered our drinks, appetizer and main dish all at the same time. We got the appetizer before anything else but finished it before they could get our drinks out. Which took a while. The food was good, just didn't get to enjoy it as soon as it came out. Also Had to wait a while for the silverware.

I'm usually a very fair reviewer, but my experience at this specific TGI Fridays had me and my fair lady about 2-3 minutes from getting up and leaving.  After waiting 46 minutes and having not received our simple salads.  I hope that no patron visits this TGI Fridays for the first time otherwise they would never go to a TGI Fridays again.  I know that the brand isn't the fault, but merely the way this specific branch is run.  I'll attempt to reach out to the branch manager or higher to explain and attempt to bring some light to this restaurant. I will list out the scenario so future visitors can decide if this specific address for TGI Fridays they would really endure visiting.  We spent a majority of the day shopping and running errands, and needed to hit the gym later in the evening.  Since we hadn't eaten much previously, I figured a salad before the workout would help and the parking lot at this TGI Fridays was empty.  So service should be pretty quick and snappy for a measly salad right?  Well, upon entering it took about 5 minutes of standing next to the hostess stand before we were seated.  Upon being seated, it took ten minutes for a waiter to come and receive our drink orders, water with lemon.  Then two separate parties came in, and they were seated.  They then received more attentive service before us but I let that slide.  The kicker was after about 15 minutes we finally got our waters, and gave the waiter our salad orders with a side of sweet potato fries.  One of the other tables got one of the large appetizer samplers.  We figured surely our salads should be ready soon if they got their order so quickly and we've been staying longer.  Well our waiter was working our table plus the other two and it was becoming increasingly frustrating that our quick meal turned into an actual event.  As our wait time approached 40 minutes, I was about to just get up and leave, but decided to give them another chance.  46 minuets into the meal our food came out, we had a weak amount of sweet potato fries made for us but the salads came out and tasted fine. At this point I was annoyed, but didn't bother to take it out on anyone we just kept our comments.  I noted that they forgot the pecan crusted chicken on my salad so someone had the chef cook that up for me and about 7-8 minutes later it came out.  For what this experience is worth, I would give it 0 stars.  However, you can't do that on yelp and at least when the food finally arrived in bits and pieces off the assembly line it tasted good enough.  Also the fork that I initially had was all bent up, I tried to fix it myself then just requested a new set of silverware...  Overall, I'm a easy going person so despite our waiter making a few mistakes with our order, etc.  His attitude was positive and he didn't give off a vibe that he wasn't trying.  I just guess that something dramatic was going bad back in the kitchen because receiving our order took way too long for a simple salad.  Needless to say, I am not inclined to eat at this TGI Fridays or anyone for that matter.  I will attempt to put effort into getting the issue fixed so others don't suffer the same way we did.

So every time we come to this particular TGI, there is always some kind of mishap between the store employees or on our food order. It's even gone to the point where we were at another TGI and the server we have there was chatting with us and said there's always issues at the Potomac mills store. When we go to PM, there's always the same 2 gentleman servers working their butts off. They are amazing, amazing servers. There's usually 3-4 hosts and they never seem pleased we are there. Usually it takes 5 mins for them to stop chatting for them to finally ask how many and to sit us. Always with lots of sass and eye rolling of course. When we order take out, there is always an issue with the order. Always something forgotten. I understand mistakes are going to be made, we are only human. But every time? It shouldn't be every time. And if it's too busy, maybe it's time to hire more people. Instead of having an ex employee stand outside cussing telling people to not go in.... all I'm saying.  Anyways. We pay good money for the food there, always tip the servers well. And I'm starting to feel like instead of driving 10 minutes to our local, we should drive 25 to the one in Springfield. Springfield is always understanding, always excited to greet us. The server is always wonderful. Food is always great. The managers are always on the floor talking to customers. I've never once let alone, seen a manager at Potomac Mills.  None the less, we went again tonight. It was rather busy. Our food wasn't ready until 15 minutes after the time it should be "ready for pick up"- which, is usual at this store. Smells good all the way home. Only to reach our grand destination and see some of our food is missing. As usual.
It was crowded and so busy when we went there on Friday night  They said 20-25 wait for 3 people... and we walked out of there. Not worth the wait.

Endless apps are back.  In town on business.  Stopped here the other night for several items off of the $10 app menu.  With a glass of wine to settle in. I sat in the bar area.  Server did her job. I was pleased with the service here.  Along with the current choices of endless apps.

I've never had anything to say on yelp...but this place is terrible. The service was horrible. The managers stared at us the whole time to make sure we weren't sharing food for the 10 dollar unlimited apps, and then complained when my wife gave my 2 year old son a mozzarella stick. Our waiter took about 20 minutes just to refill our drinks and it took over an hour for our food to come. If any place deserves negative stars it's this Friday's!

18+ minutes. This is how long I was on hold to place a to go order. Called starting at home. Drove to the restaurant, went in, waited politely in line, then the door staff who had put me on hold originally, asked how I could help and I showed him my phone at 18+ min and said I've been trying to place a to-go order and this is how long I've been on hold. His first response is to look at the phone and say I didn't know you were going to come in and then disconnects the line which is still blinking, making a "boop" noise. No apology. I ask for the manager and they come and ask what the issue is. I repeat what happen including the noise made and all I get is a look at the host and she snatches a menu and asks what I want. I've been coming to this restaurant for as long as I can recall (12-15+ years) and this is the most unprofessional response I've seen in a the staff here. I'd rather drive to the Manassas or Springfield Friday's than come here again. @TGIFridays you need to do better.

Friday's is our favorite restaurant for a really good burger and really good ribs. So when we stopped at the location near Potomac Mills for a meal, we were surprised and disappointed.  My burger was awesome, as always.  My husband's ribs, not so much. They were dripping with so much sauce he had to wipe some off to make them edible. The restaurant was dirty, garbage/food under our table and our feet stuck to the floor. If there was a manager working, it wasn't apparent. Servers were more focused on socializing and not on customers. Restaurant was maybe at 20% capacity. We'll stick to our home location in Fairfax and suggest the Potomac Mills location do better.

Wish I could give it a zero. Waited 30 min when we were told 15 min wait. Sat down ordered and waited another 50 min before half the meal came out. Then waited another 15 min for the rest of our families meal. Awful food taste greasy, cold, and just poor service!

I wish I could give this place ZERO stars!!!  This is an awful restaurant with people who show little etiquette in their treatment of customers AND their employees.  I know someone who works at this establishment and the stuff that goes on would not be accepted at a penitentiary much less a restaurant.  Just a complete environment of hostility and lack of professionalism. There are a TON of better restaurants to choose in the area.  For your own benefit; DO NOT waste your time here.
Horrible. Sat for 20 minutes with my son and no even bothered to ask if we wanted water.

Went here on Cinco De Mayo and the service was terrible. The food was even worse. It took about 30 minutes for one beer to be delivered to our table and the restaurant wasn't even crowded. Save your money and visit another restaurant. Would give zero stars if I could.

Our usual experience with TGI Fridays is usually good. This particular location however was just horrible. The staff was very unprofessional. The cook must've been off as well. The food was just horrible. For one we ordered plain chicken wings, they were made very hard, and no we did not ask for this. We could hear our server talking about how unpleasant they looked, but yet he still bought them to the table. The manager did apologize, which was okay. But I will not be going back to this location.   P.S the fries were great! Lol

This particular location was definitely a waste of time and money. Every single thing I ordered tasted like crap and my boyfriend was super unimpressed as well. We always go to the tysons and Fairfax TGI locations with no problem and this is how we know that the fried green beans were made totally different and not enjoyable at all. My burger was super greasy and tasteless and made me feel sick after. His Mahi mahi fish sandwich had the tiniest amount of fish in it the poor guy ended up leaving still hungry.  This location is pretty busy on Friday night, I can't imagine for the food though. The extra star is because the server tried to be as attentive as possible despite her numerous amount of tables. The host was friendly and eccentric. The chef needs further training perhaps from the guys at the Tysons location.
Horrible service. Find somewhere else to take your family and spend your hard earned money.

I treated my mom to lunch here and we had an amazing time. Our waitress Iyonna was absolutely spectacular! We both ordered endless apps and the food came out timely and piping hot each and every time! I would highly recommend coming here for a quick lunch.

This is the worst TGIF! My boyfriend and I came for a late night bite for some apps to be honest because he wanted to get out the house. The waitress was horrible she was more concentrated in cleaning up and putting away chairs then being attentive to her table. We always had to get her attention to order something. The food tasted as if I bought the frozen apps from the grocery store and cooked them myself not all but most. The potstickers jack Daniels traditional wings were okay everything is was on yuck (boneless wings were too breaded and over sauced, BBQ flatbread not tasteful, potato skins and mozzarella sticks were just not cooked properly) I just think management really needs to concentrate on training staff to provide better customer service and cooking their food better. Even if it's the last resort I refuse to ever come to this establishment. And although we got really poor customer service we still tipped the girl 3 dollars which she didn't deserve and usually we are very generous tippers but in this case we did the bare min. If it was up to me she would have gotta .50 save yourself the trouble find another late night place to catch a bite to eat and a drink because it's not with the time drive or your money.

I've been to this location 3 times and every time I go there I have hopes the service will get better! And every single time it's a disappointment. The bartenders and waiters are always arguing over orders. It is unprofessional and customer service sucks! The food comes out hours after you ordered and expect it to be cold! Thank you TGIF

Didn't even eat here. Told there would be a 15 minute wait at 7:30PM when 2/3 of the restaurant was empty and the tables were clean. Not sure if this was a staffing issue or what, but that's crazy. Management should not allow that to happen.

Do yourself a favor... find somewhere else to eat. The service is horrendous, the drinks are as bad as the service. The food was disgusting and we were unable to finish our meal. But hey, the mozzarella sticks were good.

I would rather drive to Springfield to get some Friday's rather then go to this Woodbridge location and I Live here! It's not the food in this case, it's the service lol yoooo it looks like that staff is trying to suck on purpose, if their is any type of management that manages these restaurants they're clearly neglecting this location! It legit gets worse every time, if their was half professionalism the chic-fil-a next door offered, maybe, just maybe it'll be worth another shot, till then, unless you want to be super pissed trying to get a meal, steer clear, funny enough, everyone I mention this too agrees.

I'm not going to lie, I have had some bad experience here before. I even had to Walk Out Twice after being seated because we weren't waited on. Well that all change last night. If you go in there on a Friday and you have Derrick as a waiter, you'll be blessed.... Thank me later.

Wow, dreadfully slow. We were driving through on our way to DC and wanted a quick lunch. Hardly anyone was in the restaurant, and it took over an hour to get our food. There's no excuse for this slow service!! Avoid this place.

Only place open on a Sunday after 10pm. Based on my observation, the clientele is predominantly black. On my visit, 100% black. This is significant. The surrounding area is majority middle class white. The food is average. Edible. Very slow bar service. Asked pointedly for my glass of Malbec to arrive simultaneous to the delivery of my (overdone) ribeye, but had to wait for the bartender to open a bottle. Bush league, but probably standard for a black hangout. No sophistication, but none expected or anticipated. Won't return. Can make a better steak on my cast iron skillet. I'm glad the blacks have a suburban joint out in which they can hang.

Used to really enjoy coming here - in fact it was the sesame jack chicken strips that called us to Fridays tonight.  The food was just ok and barely warm. The noise level is reminiscent of a dance bar/club, the floor was sticky and the bathrooms were in rough shape.  The highlight of the evening was a member of the staffs (not our waitress sadly) engaging and sweet attitude.  I believe she was the hostess and she was lovely.  I guess this old favorite will just be a memory now- not going back :(

So hate to do this but maybe they will fix some of the problems with this certain Friday's. I have come here about 6 to 7 times and I hate to say the endless apps and drink specials are the only thing keeping me coming but I'm done now. Only one server has ever been good here and that was the guy in the bar with glasses. He was awesome but that's it. You have a server that is just awful and forgets about you and sad to say others have described her as being the same. She is a cocktail server btw. I'm a server myself so I know how it goes and I understand if the kitchen is behind and such but from being there when it is slow that would be no excuse. I wish management would do something about this because I'm sure they know what's going on. I would not recommend this Friday's to anyone. Please don't waste your time
Love,love the 10 dollar apps. The food and service is great. We go there often and meets friends for drinks and apps.

Despite the abundance of bad reviews we decided to come here anyways. Had to wait 10minutes for a table while plenty of open tables were in plain view...ok nbd maybe they are low staffed? They walk us to a table, clearly I'm carrying our toddler and yet they don't bring us a high chair...we sit down and already knew what we wanted so we gave them our order which was just appetizers. We waited 40 minutes and still didn't have our appetizers. The place wasn't even busy, which made the situation more irritating. Needless to say we won't be returning here and wouldn't recommend it to others.

It sucks that this is the only TGI in Woodbridge, love it but HATE this location I always brush my experience off and come back but this time I will not. Our waiter was really nice but oh my god it's like he forgets what we asked when he would leave our table. I had to ask him 3 times for my sons apple juice and our refills, not to mention my refill had a bug in it, YES A BUG. We got the endless apps and every time I've been there the waiters will bring out our apps and immediately ask what we want for the next one. This guy would leave for hours then come back and ask us what we wanted next (he didn't have a note pad to write it down) left them came back minutes later to ask "what did you want again?"......moral of this is go to another TGI

I went to Fridays tonight and order the endless apps and never got my food until an hour later never got my water I ordered and never got my second drinks I ordered either I will never go back to that one again

I'm very disappointed with the service, the waitress come 10 minutes more after to take the order. there isn't organization I don't know who is the waitress. I was with my husband they give us the appetizers and we don't have napkins forks or knives. Food is very good but the service is very very very very horrible!!!!!

Came in on a Tuesday at 1:50pm. There were about two people sitting at the bar and three groups of about 3 each sitting at tables in the dining area. They had two servers working. It took us about 5 minutes for someone to acknowledge us and take us to our seats. We then waited at least 5 minutes for a waiter to come by. He dropped off the menus without taking our drink orders and disappeared again. Finally he came back and we ordered drinks and told him we were ready to order food but he said he'd bring the drinks first and then come back to take the food order. By 2:30pm we still hadn't received our drinks so we got up and left. One of the servers came over as we were leaving and seemed shocked that we were leaving...

Came here last night with some friends. Place was packed so I figured it was going to be a great night. Our waitress was not even good from the start. We decided to do the endless apps. Also ordered drinks from the all day happy hour menu. The people I was with we ordered a sauzrita & 2 Long Island drinks. Our apps came out before the drinks and were not appetizing. Our waitress failed to tell us only boneless wings were available on endless apps and not traditional. She took very long on drink refills and bringing out food. My other two friends had to tell her 2 times for their basket of fries she kept forgetting. Then tried to tell a lame story when she should of said I messed up and forgot to write down the fries on her pad in the first place. All throughout the night it would take 10-15 mins before she would check on us. Food was coming out cold due to her talking in the back. I say this because we could see into the kitchen and most of the time she was running her mouth. The nachos on the endless apps are a joke 20 chips and one piece of cheese on the nachos. I wouldn't come back server overcharged us after looking at financial statements by $40. I will not be returning

I decided to treat myself to a nice lunch while teleworking. I hadn't eaten at TGIFriday at a long time so I ordered online. I ordered the fried green beens, the ribeye (medium well) with broccoli and potatoes. I received a call from TGIFriday informing me that they were out of the wasabi sauce for the green beans and then another call that they were out of ribeyes. When I agreed to another cut of steak, the young lady on the phone told me they would throw in a cheesecake for free. I was appreciative. When I picked up my order, the manager charged me for the cheesecake. When I got home, I noticed I had zucchini and squash instead of broccoli and the steak was so beyond well done that is was difficult to cut. I  remember now why I don't usually eat at TGIFriday. I had potatoes and cheesecake for lunch for $38.

This is by far the WORST TGIF I have ever eaten in. I came to this location about 5 years ago and the service wouldn't even rank a 1 Star.  This was the first time I have been back and there have been absolutely NO improvement. It wasn't crowded but it took 35 mins to get drinks and I'm talking about lemonade.  We ordered soup and breadsticks for starters and of course it came out with the meal which took almost 50 minutes and it was cold. The waitress never checked on our table after she took our order. If a restaurant still has bad service after 5 years, this is a place I will never visit again!

Is it possible to give no stars.... common sense but even though service could be slow, you still need to be attentive to the people who are coming into the establishment where you work and give good customer service. I highly reccomend retraining all of the staff of how to do customer service if they want to keep their jobs.

5 stars because our server Joshua was excellent. The best server I have ever had in all the restaurants that I've visited. No exaggeration here. The food is not amazing but it is good and palatable. I don't mind it at all. I enjoyed my food very much and the service was amazing. Joshua made this experience a 5 star experience.
Slow and terrible service. The servers were not attentive to us. It took like 15 mins to get a small plate of like 6 boneless wings. Definitely do not recommend

Service was absolutely horrific. After walking in it took about 3 minutes before anyone even acknowledged us. Then the hostess came over and sat the family who came in behind us first...At the last table available in the dining room (despite around half of them being empty). We were then seated in the bar area after a both was cleaned off. After another 10 or so minutes another 2 parties had been seated in the bar and the waitress began taking their orders before ours while never acknowledging us. Ended up just leaving as customer service seemed to be at the bottom of everyone's priorities. A simple acknowledgement or at least a drink ordered being taken by the hostess (or anyone) would have went a long way.

The service is horrible. We didn't have someone come to our table until about 10 minutes after we sat down. The server didn't even apologize for keeping us waiting. He never checked on our drinks or checked on us once after the food was delivered. This Friday's has gone downhill.

Is not my first time here but it is the first time that they are really slow. There is barely anybody in the place and the service was the worst. The waitress asked for the drinks and Appetizers while she kept sneezing in front of us. Brought the drinks but appetizer never came until 32 minuts later and in five minutes our food was in front. She literally asked if the food was good and disappeared. The salmon was dry and the chicken, well just take a look at the pics. If you are considering stoping in here, please there are plenty of places around, just think twice.

Today I had great service. So, I give my waitress 5 stars, but everything else 4 stars. It is clear to me this TGI Fridays is understaffed. For all the tables the 2 servers had, they did an amazing job. Food was okay. I sent back the brussel sprouts because they were not the best. Im sure it wasn't the chef, rather the recipe. Overall, my experience was great.

Horrible service!!! Worst TGI Friday's I've been to. The staff was so slow and they don't care about there customers got there at 10:30 got seated at 11 and didn't get my food and drinks till 12!!!! Don't go here!!!!

I have no clue what has happened to this Friday's location, but the food is not as good as it used to be. I have been visiting this location for over 7 years and have seen a drastic decline in cooks ability. The times I have visited the staff have generally been professional, except the time I got my purse stolen. Altogether, I will drive miles to another Friday's location or simply choose another restaurant over this particular location now. ( Only was able to credit 2 stars because the majority of employees that have serviced me were great)
